citeinfo.origin: Feliks M. Persits, Contractor to USGS, Denver, CO (comp.)
Douglas W. Steinshouer, Contractor to USGS, Denver, CO (comp.)
Timothy R. Klett, USGS, Denver, CO (comp.) and others
citeinfo.title: World Total Petroleum System Summary Result Data (tps_sumg -- unprojected in latitude and longitude coordinates)
World Petroleum Assessment 2000 -- Digital Data Series (DDS) 60

serinfo.sername: U.S. Geological Survey Digital Data Series

descript.abstract: This shapefile includes arcs and polygons that describe U.S. Geological Survey delineated Total Petroleum Systems of the World. Each petroleum system is defined as a mappable entity encompassing genetically related petroleum that occurs in seeps, shows and accumulations (discovered or undiscovered) that have been generated by a pod, or by closely related pods, of mature source rock, together with the essental mappable geologic elements (source, reservoir, seal and overburden rocks) that control fundamental processes of generation, migration, entrapment and preservation of petroleum. Total petroleum systems are described by U.S. Geological Survey scientists on the basis of exploration and production histories, and extensive literature searches. Total petroleum systems are identified with a numeric code derived from the numeric code of the World Geologic Provinces as defined by the U.S. Geological Survey World Energy Project. Most total petroleum systems are contained within a single geologic province, but there are numerous cases where systems span more than one province. Summary results of the assessment are presented as attributes of this shapefile.
descript.purpose: This shapefile is intended to delineate the Total Petroleum Systems used in the preparation of World Petroleum Assessment 2000 and to present summary assessment results.
descript.supplinf: For data management purposes the world is divided into eight energy regions corresponding approximately to the economic regions of the world as defined by the U.S. Department of State. Except in the case of the United States, most region and province boundaries are not controlled by the presence of political or administrative boundaries. Geologic province boundaries are determined by World Energy Project Regional Coordinators and others on the basis of natural geologic entities and may include a dominant geologic structural element or a number of continuous elements. Provinces are divided into Total Petroleum Systems defined by the presence of source rocks, migration paths, traps and seals. Total petroleum systems are numbered from the geologic province that they are most closely associated with and they inherit the first digit reference to the energy region. Because many total petroleum systems overlap with one another, the coverage that this shapefile is derived from has Arc/Info region topology. Each total petroleum system constitutes a region.

idinfo.datacred:
Digital compilation - Feliks M. Persits and Douglas W. Steinshouer Editing and quality assurance - Feliks M. Persits and Douglas W. Steinshouer Summary assessment results data - Timothy R. Klett Documentation and metadata - Douglas W. Steinshouer Delineation of total petroleum systems - World Energy Project Regional Coordinators and others
The Regional Coordinators are
Region 1 - The Former Soviet Union - Gregory F. Ulmishek, USGS, Denver, CO Region 2 - The Middle East and North Africa - Thomas S. Ahlbrandt, USGS, Denver, CO Region 3 - Asia Pacific - Robert T. Ryder, USGS, Reston, VA Region 4 - Europe - Donald L. Gautier, USGS, Menlo Park, CA Region 5 - North America - Leslie B. Magoon III, USGS, Menlo Park, CA Region 6 - Central and South America - Christopher J. Schenk, USGS, Denver, CO Region 7 - Sub-Saharan Africa - Ronald R. Charpentier, USGS, Denver, CO Region 8 - South Asia - Craig J. Wandrey, USGS, Denver, CO

attracc.attraccr: The attribute values have been reviewed.

dataqual.logic: Polygon topologies is present, polygons are bounded at extent of coverage. Each polygon represents a total petroleum system. There are numerous overlapping polygons.
dataqual.complete: Page-sized maps have been printed and distributed to the Regional Coordinators for review of total petroleum system boundaries, numeric codes and names. Updates have been made where necessary.

horizpa.horizpar: It is not possible to calculate a definitive measure of the horizontal positional accuracy of this coverage because it is a composite data set compiled from a variety of sources using a variety of methodologies. Positional accuracy is dependent upon the extent of geologic knowledge available about the area delineated for each total petroleum system. This includes the density of oil/gas field centerpoints and well locations in the Petroconsultants Exploration and Production Database (1996) and, in the case of Canada, the density of oil/gas pool centerpoints from the NRG Associates Inc. Significant Oil and Gas Pools of Canada Database (1996) The maximum possible accuracy is twice fuzzy tolerance of 500 meters, or 1000 meters. Because of the heterogenous variety of source data, generally of small-scale, used in delineating the province boundaries, there is no datum or spheroid defined. At the average estimated compilation scale of 1:5,000,000, there is no geodetic control to define a datum or a spheroid without introducing false precision.

citeinfo.title: Arcworld Digital Map of the World

srcinfo.srccontr: Shorelines, political boundaries, rivers and cities base cartographic layers used as a background reference on maps used to define total petroleum systems.

procstep.procdesc: Large maps scaled to the extent of each assessed geologic province are plotted portraying geologic provinces along with shorelines, rivers, surficial geology, political boundaries, cities, oil and gas field centerpoints and oil and gas wells and provided to geologists conducting assessment, who delineate total petroleum systems, minimum petroleum systems, assessment units and pods of active source rock on the maps with colored pencils. In some cases structural features are digitized from various map sources and plotted on the maps as additional thematic layers.

The geologic province maps on which geologists have drawn boundaries of total petroleum systems are scanned as digital images. Digital images are registered and rectified, and total petroleum system boundaries are digitized on-screen in Arc/Info Arcedit as coverages based on each geologic province. Each coverage has polygon topology created with the CLEAN and BUILD commands. Region topology is defined as each total petroleum system comprising a region.

Maps depicting the geologic provinces, total petroleum systems, assessment units and base map layers are plotted and submitted to assessing geologists for verification of digital capture of total petroleum system boundaries, names and numeric codes. When necessary, geologists indicate needed changes, maps are scanned and changes are digitized. Changes are verified by repeating steps until geologists are satisfied.
Total petroleum system coverages based on geologic provinces are merged to produce a world total petroleum system coverage with region topology.

Page-sized maps of each total petroleum system are printed and submitted to Regional Coordinators for verification of total petroleum system boundaries, names and numeric codes. When necessary, changes are made and the world total petroleum system coverage is updated.

Summary data produced by resource-assessment of assessment units are aggregated to the total petroleum systems. These summary data are joined to the Region Attribute Table of the world total petroleum system coverage.
Coverage of total petroleum systems is projected to geographic latitude and longitude coordinates.
Arc/Info coverage is opened as a theme in Arcview and saved as a shapefile.

enttyp.enttypd: Name, numeric code and summary results data of total petroleum systems defined in World Petroleum Assessment 2000. Data Base Table.

attr.attrdef: Area of polygon
Perimeter of polygon
Internal feature number
Feature identification number

Unique numeric identifier of total petroleum system. (Character item.) First digit refers to USGS energy region of the world. Second three digits reference geologic province. Third two digits identify total petroleum system.
Name of total petroleum system.

Gas to oil ratio calculated from oil and gas endowments of assessed assessment unit(s) in total petroleum system, Cubic feet of gas to barrels of oil (CFG/BO). (Gor = Endo_gas/Endo_oil) No data value is -9999
Oil or gas as major commodity present in total petroleum system.

edom.edomvd: Gas to oil ratio is less than 20,000 cubic feet of gas/barrel of oil (CFG/BO) for both discovered and anticipated undiscovered resources.
Gas to oil ratio is equal to or greater than 20,000 cubic feet of gas/barrel of oil (CFG/BO) for both discovered and anticipated undiscovered resources.
Determination of major commodity is not available.

attr.attrdef: Cumulative oil of fields assigned to assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system, Million barrels of oil (MMBO) Reported volume of oil that has been produced. No data value is -9999

Remaining oil of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Million barrels of oil (MMBO). The difference between known and cumulative oil. (Rem_oil = Kwn_oil - Cum_oil) No data value is -9999 Other negative values reflect inconsistencies in reported data.

Known (discovered) oil of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the province, Million barrels of oil (MMBO). Reported discovered oil (the sum of cumulative oil production and remaining oil reserves). (Kwn_oil = Cum_oil + Rem_oil) No data value is -9999

Cumulative gas production of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Billion cubic feet of gas (BCFG). Reported volume of gas that has been reported. No data value is -9999.

Remaining gas reserves of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system, Billion cubic feet of gas (BCFG). The difference between known (discovered) gas and cumulative gas production. (Rem_gas = Kwn_gas - Cum_gas) No data value is -9999

Known (discovered) gas of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Billion cubic feet of gas (BCFG). Reported discovered volume (the sum of cumulative production and remaining reserves). (Kwn_gas = Cum_gas + Rem_gas) No data value is -9999

Cumulative natural gas liquids production of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Million barrels of natural gas liquids (MMBNGL). Reported volume of natural gas liquids that have been produced. No data value is -9999.

Remaining natural gas liquids reserves of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Million barrels of natural gas liquids (MMBNGL). The difference between known (discovered) and cumulative natural gas liquids production. (Rem_ngl = Kwn_ngl - Cum_ngl) No data value is -9999 Other negative values reflect inconsistencies in reported data.

Known (discovered) natural gas liquids of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Million barrels of natural gas liquids (MMBNGL). Reported discovered volume (the sum of cumulative production and remaining reserves) of natural gas liquids. (Kwn_ngl = Cum_ngl + Rem_ngl) No data value is -9999

Total known (discovered) petroleum reserves of fields assigned to assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Million barrels of oil equivalent (MMBOE). Reported discovered volume (the sum of cumulative production and remaining reserves) of oil, gas and natural gas liquids. (Kwn_pet = Kwn_oil + Kwn_gas + Kwn_ngl) No data value is -9999

Mean undiscovered conventional oil resources in assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Million barrels of oil (MMBO). Mean volume estimated in World Petroleum Assessment 2000. No data value is -9999.

Mean undiscovered conventional gas resources in assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Billion cubic feet of gas (BCFG). Mean volume estimated in World Petroleum Assessment 2000. No data value is -9999

Mean undiscovered conventional natural gas liquids resources in assessed assessment unit(s) in total petroleum system. Million barrels of natural gas liquids (MMBNGL). Mean volume estimated by World Petroleum Assessment 2000. No data value is -9999

Oil endowment of assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Million barrels of oil (MMBO). The sum of known (discovered) oil and mean undiscovered conventional oil. (Endo_oil = Kwn_oil + Unds_oil) No data value is -9999

Gas endowment of assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Billion cubic feet of gas (BCFG). The sum of known (discovered) gas and mean undiscovered conventional gas. (Endo_gas = Kwn_gas + Futr_gas) No data value is -9999.

Natural gas liquids endowment of assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Million barrels of natural gas liquids (MMBNGL). The sum of known (discovered) natural gas liquids and mean undiscovered conventional natural gas liquids. (Endo_ngl = Kwn_ngl + Futr_ngl) No data value is -9999

Discovery maturity of oil in assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Percentage of oil discovered (known oil) with respect to oil endowment. ((Matr_oil = Kwn_oil/Endo_oil) * 100) No data value is -9999

Discovery maturity of gas in assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Percentage of gas discovered (known gas) with respect to gas endowment. ((Matr_gas = Kwn_gas/Endo_gas) * 100) No data value = -9999

Discovery maturity of natural gas liquids in assessed assessment unit(s) in the total petroleum system. Percentage of natural gas liquids discovered (known natural gas liquids) with respect to natural gas liquids endowment. ((Matr_ngl = Kwn_ngl/Endo_ngl) * 100) No data value is -9999

digtinfo.formcont: A service compliant with ESRI ArcXML protocol which includes this dataset as a theme within the service.

onlinopt.accinstr: This URL links to a web-based interactive mapping system that accesses an ArcIMS Image Map Service. The mapservice can also be accessed using any custom client that adheres to the protocol specified through ArcXML.
